c.delay = System.currentTimeMillis() + 2000;
added…
and then:
if (c.delay > System.currentTimeMillis()) {
return;
}
[/quote]

Where would I put the c.delay = System.currentTimeMillis() + 2000; ?[/quote]
Exactly where it’s written…before the ‘return;’ …and it might even be ‘break;’

item.title: [Fixed] Eating Delay
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Hey, I’ve been working rlly hard on a near blank 194 look a like and I added eating foods, however I’ve been stuck for a couple hours on how to add the eat delay cuz right now a player can spam click food and eat like a full inventory in about 2 seconds.

This is the bit I’ve got in the Sea Turtle eating case. Every time a food item is clicked, it goes thru the switch statement and looks for the ID of the item clicked, again this is for the Sea Turtle.

if (c.delay < System.currentTimeMillis()) { // if (time > 2000) { c.playAnimation(anim); c.deleteItem(397, c.getItemSlot(397), 1); c.increaseHp(21); c.sendMessage("You eat the " + message[0]+ "."); // j = 0; // } }

These are the variables in client.java

public long animationReset = System.currentTimeMillis();
public long delay = animationReset + 1500;

This currently does not work.

Read full topic
